claim.body:
an engine, the control system comprising:
a torque phase detection module that detects a start of a torque phase of an upshift of a transmission coupled to the engine;
a torque request generation module that selectively generates an engine torque request at the start of the torque phase of the transmission upshift; and
an engine torque control module that selectively controls engine torque during the torque phase of the transmission upshift based on the engine torque request, wherein the engine torque control module controls engine torque during the torque phase independent from the engine torque request when a desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request is greater than a predetermined threshold.

claim-text.content: 1. A control system for an engine, the control system comprising:
a torque phase detection module that detects a start of a torque phase of an upshift of a transmission coupled to the engine;
a torque request generation module that selectively generates an engine torque request at the start of the torque phase of the transmission upshift; and

an engine torque control module that selectively controls engine torque during the torque phase of the transmission upshift based on the engine torque request, wherein the engine torque control module controls engine torque during the torque phase independent from the engine torque request when a desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request is greater than a predetermined threshold.

claim.body:
the torque request generation module does not generate the engine torque request when the desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request is greater than the predetermined threshold; and
the predetermined threshold is equal to a sum of a driver torque request and a predetermined engine torque offset.

claim-text.content: the torque request generation module does not generate the engine torque request when the desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request is greater than the predetermined threshold; and
the predetermined threshold is equal to a sum of a driver torque request and a predetermined engine torque offset.

claim.body: the engine torque control module increases engine torque to the desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request during the torque phase of the transmission upshift.

content: , wherein the engine torque control module increases engine torque to the desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request during the torque phase of the transmission upshift.

claim.body: the engine torque control module increases engine torque to the desired engine torque at a predetermined rate.

content: , wherein the engine torque control module increases engine torque to the desired engine torque at a predetermined rate.

claim.body: the engine torque control module controls engine torque during an inertia phase of the transmission upshift to a final engine torque corresponding to a new gear ratio, wherein the inertia phase of the transmission upshift is after the torque phase of the transmission upshift.

content: , wherein the engine torque control module controls engine torque during an inertia phase of the transmission upshift to a final engine torque corresponding to a new gear ratio, wherein the inertia phase of the transmission upshift is after the torque phase of the transmission upshift.

claim.body: an off-going clutch of the transmission is disengaged during the torque phase of the upshift, and wherein an on-coming clutch of the transmission is engaged during the inertia phase of the upshift.

content: , wherein an off-going clutch of the transmission is disengaged during the torque phase of the upshift, and wherein an on-coming clutch of the transmission is engaged during the inertia phase of the upshift.

claim.body: the engine torque control module increases engine torque during the inertia phase of the transmission upshift from the desired engine torque to the final engine torque.

content: , wherein the engine torque control module increases engine torque during the inertia phase of the transmission upshift from the desired engine torque to the final engine torque.

claim.body: the engine torque control module controls engine torque during the inertia phase of the upshift to maintain constant vehicle acceleration.

content: , wherein the engine torque control module controls engine torque during the inertia phase of the upshift to maintain constant vehicle acceleration.

claim.body: the engine torque request is based on at least one of a plurality of operating parameters.

content: , wherein the engine torque request is based on at least one of a plurality of operating parameters.

claim.body: the plurality of operating parameters include engine load, throttle position, engine speed, transmission input shaft speed (TISS), and transmission output shaft speed (TOSS).

content: , wherein the plurality of operating parameters include engine load, throttle position, engine speed, transmission input shaft speed (TISS), and transmission output shaft speed (TOSS).

claim-text.content: 11. A method for controlling an engine, the method comprising:
detecting a start of a torque phase of an upshift of a transmission coupled to the engine;
selectively generating an engine torque request at the start of the torque phase of the transmission upshift;
selectively controlling engine torque during the torque phase of the transmission upshift based on the engine torque request; and

controlling engine torque during the torque phase independent from the engine torque request when a desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request is greater than a predetermined threshold.

claim.body: the engine torque request when the desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request is greater than the predetermined threshold, wherein the predetermined threshold is equal to a sum of a driver torque request and a predetermined engine torque offset.

content: , further comprising not generating the engine torque request when the desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request is greater than the predetermined threshold, wherein the predetermined threshold is equal to a sum of a driver torque request and a predetermined engine torque offset.

claim.body: engine torque to the desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request during the torque phase of the transmission upshift.

content: , further comprising increasing engine torque to the desired engine torque corresponding to the engine torque request during the torque phase of the transmission upshift.

claim.body: engine torque to the desired engine torque at a predetermined rate.

content: , further comprising increasing engine torque to the desired engine torque at a predetermined rate.

claim.body: engine torque during an inertia phase of the transmission upshift to a final engine torque corresponding to a new gear ratio, wherein the inertia phase of the transmission upshift is after the torque phase of the transmission upshift.

content: , further comprising controlling engine torque during an inertia phase of the transmission upshift to a final engine torque corresponding to a new gear ratio, wherein the inertia phase of the transmission upshift is after the torque phase of the transmission upshift.

claim.body: an off-going clutch of the transmission is disengaged during the torque phase of the upshift, and wherein an on-coming clutch of the transmission is engaged during the inertia phase of the upshift.

content: , wherein an off-going clutch of the transmission is disengaged during the torque phase of the upshift, and wherein an on-coming clutch of the transmission is engaged during the inertia phase of the upshift.

claim.body: engine torque during the inertia phase of the transmission upshift from the desired engine torque to the final engine torque.

content: , further comprising increasing engine torque during the inertia phase of the transmission upshift from the desired engine torque to the final engine torque.

claim.body: engine torque during the inertia phase of the upshift to maintain constant vehicle acceleration.

content: , further comprising controlling engine torque during the inertia phase of the upshift to maintain constant vehicle acceleration.

claim.body: the engine torque request is based on at least one of a plurality of operating parameters.

content: , wherein the engine torque request is based on at least one of a plurality of operating parameters.

claim.body: the plurality of operating parameters include engine load, throttle position, engine speed, transmission input shaft speed (TISS), and transmission output shaft speed (TOSS).

content: , wherein the plurality of operating parameters include engine load, throttle position, engine speed, transmission input shaft speed (TISS), and transmission output shaft speed (TOSS).
